sentences.sContent: The company is ready to meet the challenges of the next few years.
sentences.sCn: 公司已准备好迎接今后几年的挑战。

sentences.sContent: ...McDonald's started selling better coffee as a challenge to Starbucks...
...They hoped to challenge the claim that he never slept...
...This is the bigger challenge facing schools...
...When we begin to question our assumptions and challenge what we think we have learned from our past...
...almost all listeners are faced with a challenge because human speech lacks the stability and permanence of the printed word...
...The challenge to Internet advertisers Is to create ads that audience members remember...

phrases.pCn: 接受挑战，奋起应付挑战

words.tran: 挑战的；引起挑战性兴趣的
要求；质疑；反对；向…挑战；盘问（challenge的ing形式）

trans.tranOther: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting
